context: Evaluates correct usage of the agent-skills Confluence skill's format conversion functions. The solution must invoke markdown_to_adf and markdown_to_storage to produce the correct Atlassian content representation depending on the deployment type, handling all common Markdown elements.

checklist.name: markdown_to_adf called for Cloud
checklist.description: The solution calls markdown_to_adf with Markdown input when targeting a Cloud deployment, and the returned value is a dict with a 'type' key equal to 'doc' and a 'content' list

checklist.name: markdown_to_storage called for DC/Server
checklist.description: The solution calls markdown_to_storage with Markdown input when targeting a DataCenter or Server deployment, and the returned value is a non-empty XHTML string

checklist.name: Inline elements converted
checklist.description: Bold, italic, and inline code Markdown syntax is correctly handled by _inline_markdown_to_adf or _inline_markdown_to_html, producing the matching node types or HTML tags in the output

checklist.name: Code block with language preserved
checklist.description: A fenced code block in the Markdown input (e.g. ```python) produces a code block node in ADF with the language attribute set, or a <ac:structured-macro> with language parameter in storage format
